article.headline: Trump says he's leaving hospital Monday night and is 'feeling really good'
article.body: President Donald Trump tweeted Monday that he will leave Walter Reed hospital at 6:30 p.m. Eastern time and is "feeling really good!" Trump has been hospitalized since Friday for COVID-19 treatment, and his doctors are expected to brief reporters Monday afternoon. U.S. stocks SPX, +0.87% rose Monday as investors weighed prospects for more stimulus from Washington and tracked the president's response to treatment. In the same tweet, Trump said, "Don't be afraid of Covid. Don't let it dominate your life." The disease is responsible for more than 209,000 U.S. deaths to date, according to Johns Hopkins University.
